name: m8a

args.name: submodel
args.description: The model as a function of dN/dS

args.name: n
args.description: The number of bins for discretizing the Beta distribution

args.name: mu
args.description: The mean of the Beta distribution

args.name: gamma
args.description: The fraction of possible Beta variance given mu

description:
The m8a model is an m7 model with an additional category of neutral sites. The additional category of sites has proportion posP.

The m8a model is also equivalent to m8(posW=1).  That is, you get m8a by constraining posW to 1 in the m8 model.  Therefore, the m8a model is nested within the m8 model.

The m8a model was created as an improved null hypothesis for use in a likelihood ratio test.  (See m8a_test)

citation.title: Pervasive Adaptive Evolution in Mammalian Fertilization Proteins
